main event: On 23 November 1957, an observer reported seeing a stationary object in Crivits, Wisconsin, which appeared to have the shape of an elongated star and changed colors from red to green.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 5 minutes., The object was described as flat on top and elongated in shape., The changing colors of the object were noted as red to green., Visibility conditions included haze, which may have affected the appearance of the object., The conclusion reached was that the sighting was probably astronomical.
